snippet: A beauty competition is not just about physical attributes, the Indonesian organizer of the Miss World pageant said in explaining why there will be no bikini-clad contestants.
abstract: Hary Tanoesoedibjo, Indonesian media tycoon and organizer of Miss World beauty pageant, says contestants will wear more modest one-piece bathing suits instead of bikinis; statement seems intended in part to mollify a small but vocal group of religious conservatives who regularly stage street protests in Jakarta.

byline.original: By JOE COCHRANE and SARAH LYALL
byline.contributor: Joe Cochrane reported from Jakarta, and Sarah Lyall from London.

lead_paragraph: A beauty competition is not just about physical attributes, the Indonesian organizer of the Miss World pageant said in explaining why there will be no bikini-clad contestants.

headline.seo: Miss World Pageant Drops Bikinis This Year
headline.main: Emphasizing Inner Beauty, Pageant Says No to Bikinis
headline.print_headline: Emphasizing Inner Beauty, Pageant Says No to Bikinis
